title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This application allows users to input their sleep schedule and track the accumulated difference between their desired sleep duration and actual sleep, providing insights into their overall sleep health. It leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for visualizing and understanding sleep patterns.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a personal project dashboard. Leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, this repository demonstrates best practices for building modern web applications with a focus on clean architecture and type safety, exploring key technologies and concepts within the React and Next.js ecosystem.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using TeX for the main document and HTML for potential online presentation or related web elements. It serves as a project demonstrating my ability to create professional and customizable documents using LaTeX and web-related technologies, focusing on project management and document generation.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML-based project focused on creating a fully functional and customizable event calendar. This repository provides a foundation for building dynamic web applications that require event scheduling and display capabilities, allowing users to easily manage and view events within a user-friendly interface.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a full-stack IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase. It leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring and managing assets, offering features such as real-time location updates and detailed asset information, ideal for learning about or implementing IoT tracking solutions.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, real-time voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a project to explore serverless functions and dynamic UI updates. This repository demonstrates a functional voting system, offering a practical example of implementing interactive web features and responsive design within a Next.js framework.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to serve as a dynamic idea board for teams and individuals. This project provides a platform to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize ideas, fostering creativity and efficient project management. The board allows users to visually represent ideas with descriptions, tags, and status indicators, promoting clear communication and streamlined collaboration within a project environment.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML and Python. This repository demonstrates techniques for displaying geographical data and creating dynamic map interfaces, leveraging web technologies and Python scripting to provide insightful visualizations for project-based learning and exploration.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Flask, Python, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate full-stack development skills. This repository showcases a functional web application with user interface elements implemented using HTML and CSS, backend logic powered by Python and the Flask framework, data persistence using PostgreSQL, and deployment facilitated by shell scripts. The project provides a practical example of building and deploying a complete web application with common functionalities like creating, reading, updating, and deleting data, serving as a valuable learning resource for those interested in Python web development and database interaction.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web application built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring robot status, sensor data, and task progress, enabling efficient management and control of robotic fleets. This project is categorized as a project.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and understanding ROS logs, helping developers debug and monitor their robotics projects. This project focuses on streamlining the log analysis workflow within the ROS ecosystem.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a personal project showcasing interactive web development skills using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository serves as a playground for exploring and implementing front-end concepts, focusing on creating dynamic and engaging user experiences. It encompasses various aspects of modern web development practices and demonstrates the ability to build a complete project from concept to implementation.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a comprehensive dashboard implementation using the Next.js framework. This repository serves as a practical example for developers looking to learn and implement dashboard functionalities, covering key aspects of front-end development within the Next.js ecosystem.

It explores [insert topic details from README, e.g., efficient state management using Redux and scalable architecture with Node.js backend].  This repository serves as a playground for experimenting with modern web development techniques and best practices.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, leveraging Express.js for the backend and Vite.js for a performant frontend, designed to interact with the Gemini API. This application, styled with CSS and enhanced with JavaScript and HTML, provides a platform for [Insert brief description of application functionality gleaned from the README or imagined use case, e.g., generating creative text formats, accessing information, or brainstorming ideas].

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of finance-related projects and analyses. It serves as a learning resource and practical demonstration of applying Python to financial modeling, data analysis, and potentially other areas like portfolio optimization or risk management. Explore this repository to discover projects covering various finance topics and learn how to leverage Python for solving real-world financial problems.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a fully-fledged e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 utilizing the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching and state management. This project showcases a modern and type-safe approach to building online stores, leveraging Material UI (MUI) for a polished and responsive user interface. The repository demonstrates key e-commerce functionalities and serves as a practical example for developers looking to build similar applications using these technologies.
